channel.title: Big O Theory Club
channel.description: Thoughts on theoretical computer science and research life.

item.title: Markov Chain Monte Carlo Methods Talk by Sherry Sarkar
item.description:
We had a talk on Monte Carlo Methods using Markov Chains by Sherry this week!

Slides are available here: Slides.

item.title: Neural Network Complexity Talk by Santosh Vempala
item.description:
We had a talk on Neural Network Complexity by professor Santosh Vempala this week!

The video recording of the talk is here: Video.

item.title: Zero Knowledge Proofs Problem Session by Sherry Sarkar
item.description:
We had a problem session on zero knowledge proofs by Sherry this week!

Slides are available here: Slides.

item.title: Catalan Shuffles Talk by Prasad Tetali
item.description:
We had a talk on Catalan Shuffles by professor Prasad Tetali this week!

His website is here: Website.

item.title: Derandomization Talk by Shyamal Patel
item.description:
We had a talk on derandomization by our workshop coordinator Shyamal!

Notes are available here: Notes.

item.title: Silly Talks
item.description:
We had silly talks from vaious students as a light-hearted introduction to the art of presenting!

The slides are available here:

Cardinality of the Power Set: Slides.

Klaus Advanced Computing Building: Slides.

Graph Isomorphism: Slides.

Why Your Friends Have More: Slides.

item.title: Group Isomorphisms Talk by Daniel Hathcock
item.description:
We had a talk on introductory group theory and group isomorphisms for our first meeting of the semester!

The slides are available here: Slides.

item.title: Machine Learning Theory Talk by Diptodip Deb
item.description:
We had a talk on introductory machine learning theory (Bayesian Learning and Computational Learning Theory) this week!

The slides are available here: Slides.

item.title: Problem Session
item.description:
We had a problem session today! We have two combinatorics problems and one erasure correction problem.

You can get the problems here: Problems.

Solutions will be uploaded when we get around to it.

Announcements:

  • ARC 10 DAY is on October 24th and starts at 9:30AM in Klaus 1116! Don’t forget to check it out.
  • The Blums will be giving talks on October 27th: Blum #1 will present at 11AM in Klaus 1443 and Blum #2 will present at 5PM in Howey L4. See the ARC webpage for more.

item.title: Hello
item.description:
We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done. ~ Alan Turing

Welcome to Georgia Tech’s Big O Theory Club! More things incoming (hopefully) soon.
